-4-
water chestnuts,
etc.
Mr. Nixon was the man who made it possible for us to
validate
the Canton-Shanghai route but thats a long story which I'll save
for another time.
Sat. Dec. 12th
George Sellett's chauffeur took us for a drive
around Kowloon
and
the whole of the so called "New Territory"
which is the leased area.
It
was like the old days in China, after we got out of
the "Concrete Jungle".
High mountains franing fertile valleys in which every foot of land is used.
Hakka women with their unique hats of wide
flat straw fringed with black
cloth which hangs down all the way around five of six inches, plowing the
fields with water buffalo.
They are descended fron the aboriginal people
who were here when the Chins came down fron the north.
Many of you have
read Michener's Hawaii and may remember that the heroine, Mrs. Kee, was a
"big foot Hakka".
He drove out to a place where there was a road block and
a narrow strip of "no man's land" which separated the leased territory from
Communist China.
A Hong Kong police tower
on high ground keeps constant watch
that no
Chinese
from Red China get into the leased territory.
However,
fugitives continue to dross the border to add to Hong Kong's problem of
where to put them and how to feed them.
We loved every minute of our trip
which few drivers know how to make so we are again indebted to George Setlett.
It is all
so fantastic, especially after a ride such as we had, this
fabulous billion dollar colony which exists only at the pleasure of the
Chinese Reds.
They could take it in a matter of days, despite the growls
of the British lion, just cut off the water supply and food, most of which
comes from Red China, and the colony would be on its knees.
Sunday Dec. 13th
We spent the morning shopping, most of
the shops stay
and all building activity goes on just like any other day in the week.
Will
wind this up now and perhaps write once more before we get hime. We hope
this reaches you by Christmas.
It carries our best wishes for a very
Merry Christmas and
Happy New Year for each and every one of you.
Harold
